{{Infobox military person |name=Fedir Trofymovych Dyachenko |image= |caption= |birth_date= {{birth date|1917|6|16}} |death_date= {{death date and age|1995|8|8|1917|6|16}} |birth_place= |death_place= |placeofburial= |placeofburial_label= |nickname= |allegiance={{USSR}} |branch= |serviceyears=1941 — 1962 |rank=[[Major]] |unit= |commands= |battles=[[Eastern Front (World War II)|Great Patriotic War]] |awards=[[Hero of the Soviet Union]]
[[Order of Lenin]]
[[Order of the Patriotic War]]
[[Order of the Red Star]] |relations= |laterwork= }} '''Fedir Trofymovych Dyachenko''' ({{lang-ua|Дяченко Федір Трофимович}}; (June 16, 1917 - August 8, 1995), was a [[Ukrainians|Ukrainian]] [[Soviet Union|Soviet]] [[sniper]] during [[World War II]], credited with as many as 423 (425) kills. He was born in the village of [[Velyki Krynky]], now part of [[Hlobyne Raion]] of [[Poltava Oblast]]. Dyachenko was one of the most effective snipers in the Red Army during [[World War II]]. He was granted the status of [[Hero of the Soviet Union]] in 1944. He retired from the Soviet Army in 1962 with the rank of [[Major]]. He lived in Leningrad, working as a senior engineer at the [[Kirov Plant]]. Dyachenko died on 8 August 1995 and is buried in the city's Kovalevsky Cemetery.{{citeweb|title=hero.asp? |url=http://www.warheroes.ru/hero/hero.asp?Hero_id=5749}} == References == == Literature == * The History of Sniping and Sharpshooting by Major John L Plaster, USAR * Heroines of the Soviet Union 1941–45 Henry Sakaida (p. 20) == External links == * [http://soviet-aces-1936-53.ru/snipers/abc/d/dychenko.htm Soviet snipers/Fedir Dyachenko (ru)] {{Authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Dyachenko, Fedir}} [[Category:1908 births]] [[Category:1968 deaths]] [[Category:People from Tomponsky District]] [[Category:People from Yakutsk Oblast]] [[Category:Yakut people]] [[Category:Heroes of the Soviet Union]] [[Category:Soviet military personnel of World War II]] [[Category:Recipients of the Order of Lenin]] [[Category:Recipients of the Order of the Red Banner]] [[Category:Recipients of the Order of the Patriotic War, 2nd class]] [[Category:Recipients of the Order of the Red Star]] [[Category:Recipients of the Medal "For Courage" (Russia)]]
